meanings.definition: To apply a new coat of lacquer to (an object).
meanings.sent1: She relacquered the wooden table to make it shiny again.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman relacquered the antique cabinet to restore its beauty.
meanings.sent3: After a mishap with the paint, she had to relacquer the chair for a glossy finish.
meanings.sent4: The artist relacquered the canvas of his painting, adding depth to the colors.
meanings.sent5: The old guitar was relacquered, transforming it into a gleaming instrument once more.

meanings.definition: To coat (an object) with a fresh layer of lacquer.
meanings.sent1: He relacquered the wooden floors to protect them from scratches.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter relacquered the furniture to give it a new lease on life.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally relacquered the salad bowl, creating a shiny surprise for the guests.
meanings.sent4: The sun relacquered the leaves of the trees, making them glisten in the light.
meanings.sent5: The rain relacquered the pavement, turning it into a reflective surface.
